intro: Goeppertia roseobracteata, commonly known as the pink bract calathea, is a tropical plant native to South America. It belongs to the Marantaceae family and is characterized by its striking, colorful foliage. The plant features broad, lance-shaped leaves with a velvety texture and intricate veining patterns. Its flowers are small and inconspicuous, typically emerging from the base of the plant. Goeppertia roseobracteata thrives in bright, indirect light and requires consistently moist, well-draining soil.
